oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SHAPE SELECTIVE CATALYSIS BY ZSM-35 ZEOLITES - DISPROPORTIONATION OF ETHYLBENZENE AND ISOMERIZATION OF META-XYLENE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RANE, SJ
SATYANARAYANA, CVV
CHAKRABARTY, DK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ferrierite
zeolites
xylene isomerization
ethylbenzene disproportionation
selectivity (shape-)
deactivation
coke formation
pore structure
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Zeolite ZSM-35 with a ferrierite structure and having a silica:alumina ratio of 22.5 has been synthesized hydrothermally using pyrrolidine as the template. The acid form, HZSM-35, showed exceptionally high para selectivity in ethylbenzene disproportionation, but deactivated rapidly due to coking. A mixture of HZSM-35 with 10% HZSM-5 showed much better stability while retaining high para selectivity. Isomerization of m-xylene yielded p-xylene with high selectivity. The unique pore structure of ZSM-35 is responsible not only for its high para selectivity, but also for rapid coking, leading to deactivation.
